experience: You and Jeff both know Martin Wright, Nicole Stefanski, and 22 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
You both worked at Charles Schwab from Nov 2016 to Feb 2017

Provide vision, design, and leadership to technology teams responsible for the implementation of trading solutions on schwab.com.  Design strategy to modernize monolithic application into a micro service architecture using Pivotal Cloud Foundry, Spring Cloud Config, Steeltoe, RabbitMQ, Redis, and ASP.NET Core.Define organization blueprint and roadmap for modernization, evaluate apps for 12 factor cloud readiness, design plan for migration to cloud, and train development community on cloud platform.Transform culture with introduction of continuous delivery, test driven development, behavior driven development, agile, and lean practices.    Collaborate with development teams and technology leaders across Schwab on product development, best practices, and automation.Lead effort to modernize application stack from ASP.NET Web Forms, ASP.NET MVC to Angular and ASP.NET Web API.

Technical lead on Charles Schwab’s primary customer facing trading platform (www.schwab.com).  Define architecture and communicate technical solutions to developers. Ensure code meets quality guidelines using code analysis tools, code reviews, and monitoring code metrics. Validate application performance, and security requirements are met.Assisted development teams in transition to a new JavaScript oriented framework built on Backbone.js and Asp.Net Web API.  Work with business partners and product owners to define user story acceptance criteria, release planning, and backlog prioritization.Provide support interviewing, hiring, and training new development team members.

Design and development of web and mobile software solutions to manage energy efficiency and rebate programs.Act as technical lead for software development group; provide recommendations on software architecture and guidance to other developers.Work with utility companies to design and create data interoperability standards to communicate with external services.

Architecture, development and maintenance of work management system used to receive, manage, and bill approximately 3 million work orders annually. Components of the work management system include multiple ASP.NET websites, windows services, a windows occasionally connected client, and multiple web services.Full application lifecycle development entailing requirements gathering, architecture design (both object and database), development, testing, implementation, documentation, and maintenance.Development of .NET windows application that provides interface between work management system and QuickBooks accounting software.Development of windows service used to provide real time work order status to external utility companies via web services, modem, and telnet.
